identificationModule.briefTitle: Engagement With Digital Mental Health (DMH) Technologies in Pediatric Primary Care
identificationModule.officialTitle: Supporting Mental Health in Underserved Youth: Engagement With Digital Mental Health Technologies in Pediatric Primary Care

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The goal of this study is to use and adapt existing digital mental health technologies to advance the engagement, assessment, detection, treatment, and delivery of services for pediatric mental health. Specifically, user-centered design methodologies and an implementation science framework will be used to guide the development and implementation of the Teen Assess, Check, and Heal (TeACH) System into a pediatric primary care clinic serving teens and families from underserved communities.

Study objectives include:

1. Collaborating with underserved teens and their parents to identify strategies to target top barriers to engagement as well as top ethical concerns and requirements for cultural relevance, usability, and usefulness of the TeACH System (Phase 1)
2. Refining the plan for implementing the TeACH System through observations, interviews, and co-design workshops with pediatric primary care pediatricians and staff (Phase 2), and
3. Implementing the TeACH System into a primary care clinics and evaluating it in a randomized trial. (Phase 3)

The team will measure engagement outcomes and satisfaction with the TeACH System.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Intervention group (TeACH System psychoeducation and recommendations) and control group (evidence-based online educational materials)

armGroups.label: TeACH System Resources
armGroups.description: Patients who screen positive for anxiety will receive stakeholder-informed feedback and resources (i.e., psychoeducation and mental health recommendations).

armGroups.label: Evidence-based Resources
armGroups.description: Patients who screen positive for anxiety will receive a link to a webpage providing psychoeducation about anxiety and possible treatment options.

interventions.name: TeACH System Resources
interventions.description: Patients who screen positive for anxiety will receive psychoeducation and mental health recommendations (e.g., evidence-based apps) selected for use with the TeACH System through a collaborative, stakeholder-engaged approach completed in phases 1 and 2 of this project.

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate their understanding of anxiety on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Not at All" and 5 being "Completely"). Specifically: "I understand what anxiety is."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered following assent (in case of participant attrition through the interaction)

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate their understanding of anxiety on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Not at All" and 5 being "Completely"). Specifically: "I understand what anxiety is."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after receiving randomized feedback/resources

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate their understanding of anxiety on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Not at All" and 5 being "Completely"). Specifically: "I understand what anxiety is."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered one week after interaction with TeACH System

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate how confident they feel to take action to help their anxiety symptoms on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Not at All" to 5 being "Completely"). Specifically: "I feel confident I can do something if I feel anxiety."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered following assent (in case of participant attrition through the interaction)

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate how confident they feel to take action to help their anxiety symptoms on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Not at All" to 5 being "Completely"). Specifically: "I feel confident I can do something if I feel anxiety."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after receiving randomized feedback/resources

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate how confident they feel to take action to help their anxiety symptoms on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Not at All" to 5 being "Completely"). Specifically: "I feel confident I can do something if I feel anxiety."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered one week after interaction with TeACH System

primaryOutcomes.measure: Likelihood of using DMH for Anxiety: Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate how likely they are to use digital mental health tools for their anxiety on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Never" to 5 being "Absolutely"). Specifically: "If I feel anxiety, I would use a digital tool to help (app, website, reel/video)."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered following assent (in case of participant attrition through the interaction)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Likelihood of using DMH for Anxiety: Post Interaction
primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate how likely they are to use digital mental health tools for their anxiety on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Never" to 5 being "Absolutely"). Specifically: "If I feel anxiety, I would use a digital tool to help (app, website, reel/video)."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after receiving randomized feedback/resources

primaryOutcomes.measure: Likelihood of using DMH for Anxiety: Maintenance
primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Likert Scale); We will ask participants to rate how likely they are to use digital mental health tools for their anxiety on a Likert scale (1-5; 1 being "Never" to 5 being "Absolutely"). Specifically: "If I feel anxiety, I would use a digital tool to help (app, website, reel/video)."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered one week after interaction with TeACH System

primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Yes/No/Unsure); We will ask participants to report if they have used digital mental health tools for their anxiety symptoms. Specifically: "I have used a digital tool to help with anxiety (app, website, reel/video)."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered following assent (in case of participant attrition through the interaction)

primaryOutcomes.measure: DMH use for Anxiety: Post Interaction
primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Yes/No/Unsure); We will ask participants to report if they have used digital mental health tools for their anxiety symptoms. Specifically: "I have used a digital tool to help with anxiety (app, website, reel/video)."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after receiving randomized feedback/resources

primaryOutcomes.measure: DMH use for Anxiety: Maintenance, Change in DMH Use Following TeACH System Interaction
primaryOutcomes.description: 1 item (Yes/No/Unsure); We will ask participants to report if they have used digital mental health tools for their anxiety symptoms. Specifically: "I have used a digital tool to help with anxiety (app, website, reel/video)."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered one week after interaction with TeACH System

primaryOutcomes.description: We will track the number of teens who use the TeACH System during implementation phases and will compare this to the number of teens who were eligible but did not use the system.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of once per year.

secondaryOutcomes.description: \<1 minute to complete; Uses item response theory to pull from a large question item bank to accurately diagnose anxiety symptom severity.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after initiating use of the TeACH System; teen participants complete only once.

secondaryOutcomes.description: 3-item tool with seven response options (1-Strongly Disagree to 7-Strongly Agree) to assess satisfaction
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after receiving randomized feedback/resources from TeACH System

secondaryOutcomes.description: 3-item tool with seven response options (1-Strongly Disagree to 7-Strongly Agree) to assess satisfaction
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered one week after interaction with TeACH System

otherOutcomes.description: Name, date of birth, ethnicity, race, pronouns, gender, preferred language, reason for visiting primary care today, preferred channel of contact (i.e., text or email for follow-up)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered immediately after initiating use of the TeACH System; teen participants complete only once.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Are receiving care at specified Rush University Health System and University of Illinois at Chicago Pediatric Primary Care locations
* Are between 13-17 years of age
* Are able to speak and read in English
* Symptoms of anxiety disorder

Exclusion Criteria:

* Absence of the above inclusion criteria.
